review:
Hinge is by far the best of the big dating apps. The free features are far and away much better than the others. Accidentally swiped left? Just undo it. Hinge let‚Äôs this essential feature still be free while others charge for it. Hinge is also the most real of the big apps. I‚Äôve had more actual connections and real dates with Hinge than Tinder or Bumble‚Ä¶ COMBINED. And it‚Äôs not even close.

This would‚Äôve been a 5 star review a year ago, but a problem has surfaced that has plagued the others. One of Hinge‚Äôs best qualities has been that their process helped make sure their users are actual people. I don‚Äôt know if something changed in their verification process or a way has been found around it, but now there seems to be an alarming number of bot and fake profiles. It‚Äôs still not as bad as Tinder or Bumble, but as one of Hinge‚Äôs greatest strengths, this new problem is worrisome. Maybe what they need to do (as all dating apps should) is tie an account to a phone number, device, and GPS location (and possibly third party 2 way Authenticator). If a profile is banned because of being a bot or fake, a new one can‚Äôt be generated if it‚Äôs deemed the information has already been used. Make it more expensive and troublesome for scammers.
title: Still the best, but problematic lately

review: This is by far the worst ‚Äúdating app‚Äù that one can use. Not only do you preferences mean virtually anything (considering they show you everyone who is polar opposite of what you are looking for), it will show you 10 people and say there is no one else in your area. You‚Äôre going to tell me there is only 10 people using this app within 20+ miles? I find that extremely difficult to believe. I have deleted my account, logged out, made a new account as suggested by customer support to see if this will fix my experience... it fixed it for about 10 minutes showing me people within my preferences and then the algorithm was completely wrong once again. I even have spent money on the premium version to increase my chances- this app is pathetic and the customer support is a joke. They basically say there is nothing we can do and that the more you swipe, the better the algorithm becomes and will show you people in your preferences. How can I swipe and increase my odds when not one single person is within my preferences? I‚Äôve used this app for a year and haven‚Äôt received one like, one comment or anything and I can assure you that there is nothing wrong with myself or my profile. This is a joke and don‚Äôt spend money on this nonsense- it‚Äôs a scam and very discouraging. Hope this serves y‚Äôall some support.
title: Algorithm and Preferences

review:
Very disappointing. I think guys on here who are wanting to sneak around behind their SO‚Äôs back flock to this app because it‚Äôs not as popular as competitors. I‚Äôve used this app of and on for a couple years. I have yet been able to talk to a guy who, upon finding their social media, had a current girlfriend or wife. Other girls have gone through similar experiences with THIS app alone. My friend actually dated someone she found from Hinge for months just to get a Facebook message from his wife of 5 years one day. Another friend dated someone for a whole year just for us to discover he too had a girlfriend of two years. In my own experience, I had a random girl send me a screenshot of MY (now ex) boyfriend‚Äôs profile through Instagram. 

I see a lot of guys on Hinge also on Tinder, their Tinder bios will say looking to hookup, but their Hinge profiles will be very bland, saying the biggest risk they ever took was *this app* üôÑ. Guys I‚Äôve found with detailed profiles always seem to be hiding something or someone. If someone is using this app to cheat, or to simply get their nut, their needs to be a report system in place so their account can be disabled. This app sure is designed to be deleted alright, because in my experience it has been nothing but lies and heartbreak for me and my friends.
title: App is cheaters paradise

review:
So I have had this app for a while and have had some great dates with it.  Some of the people I met I still talk to and are genuine people and now good friends.  I‚Äôm great full for that but the app has changed suddenly.  I decided to pay for the longer subscription then I have before and right away I got so many fake/scam accounts that I couldn‚Äôt believe it!  I would match with someone and start talking then they would disappear from my matches‚Ä¶ then I would get an email from hinge saying that they were fake accounts that were removed.  I have also needed to make a lot of reports for accounts I know were fake but somehow showed verified‚Ä¶

The amount of fake accounts that showed up after I paid a lot was awful.  It got so bad that I‚Äôve never seen so many fake accounts on any other app in a short amount of time and that‚Äôs saying a lot!  One of the last people I matched with ended up just being a troll account and stood me up after we set up a date.  I regret paying for this app and had much better luck with the free version at the beginning of the year and last year.  Now there is just way to many fake accounts and no value at all for paying for the subscription
title: Honestly used to be great‚Ä¶

review:
My experience with Hinge was a complicated one, which has unfortunately led to huge financial loss. I‚Äôm writing this review so that people are more aware of potential romance scams that take advantage of the pandemic and emotionally vulnerable people.

I was matched with an initially very nice gentleman who has a relatively generic profile and we started talking. We got along really well and were able to carry on deep conversations so I was happy that I found someone who shared hobbies and values with me. About three weeks later he started to causally mentioned this investment he was doing and how great it was, and he offered to ‚Äúteach‚Äù me more. I initially wanted to learn about investment so I went to the website he provided, which eventually turned out to be a fraudulent platform that closely mimics the real investment company. Once you invest money it would show how much asset you have and it looked great until you realize you can no longer withdraw money and the ‚Äúcustomer services‚Äù ignored any related questions. As a result my personal information including bank account were compromised as well.

Hopefully as you read this, you will learn to be more cautious about any information your match sends you no matter how knowledgeable they sound or how trustworthy you think they are.
title: Be aware of romance scams

review:
Hinge is the only viable dating app that I‚Äôm aware of at the moment ‚Äî sadly tinder, bumble, okcupid, and the smaller names suffer from some combination of low population, fake accounts, ‚Äúpassport‚Äù features (people across the planet trying to talk to you), low quality members, and underwhelming features.  Hinge has real members in okay supply, okay features, and decent members.  The pre-acquisition OkCupid was the premier online dating platform, but it‚Äôs been destroyed.

The price is $50/month for premium or whatever it‚Äôs called, and $75 for 50 roses.  If you‚Äôre a highly sought after girl/guy, you might not have to spend any money ‚Äî just be willing to go through people to send likes so that you can get matches.  Likewise, you might not need the roses but they help if you‚Äôre the initiator, especially since Hinge paywalls some of the most sought-after individuals behind roses.  The price isn‚Äôt terrible, but the platform just really isn‚Äôt that great.  Profiles are highly limited and mostly superficial, and engagement is purely via messaging.  But at least real people are here trying to date.
title: Plan to spend $125-$175 to find your person

review: They say this app is designed to be deleted, and they couldn‚Äôt be more right! This app is the center place for bad people, low quality profiles, and prostitution online; and serves a place for the worst of the online dating world, I don‚Äôt know how else to put it so I‚Äôll be honest. If you consider yourself repulsive or a prostitute, welcome to Hinge this is the place for you. But knowing this, the Hinge team has made it intentionally difficult to use the app, which induces user fatigue to make sure you can‚Äôt swipe through volume because their volume is extremely low value. The app has a dark patterns based UI, and the database of people is just horrific - as if everyone who had no success on every other app just created their own - yeah this is it. This is the homeless camp of dating apps, the unhealthy people club of dating apps, the ‚ÄúI‚Äôve given up trying and I‚Äôm bitter and fat‚Äù club; and they‚Äôre all home at Hinge. And because the UI is so difficult you can‚Äôt swipe left - it takes literal seconds to X someone and their X button is intentionally placed in a bad spot and takes 2-3 taps each time to get it to trigger - all intentional UI dark patterns. Because of this, you‚Äôll end up wasting hours of your life and get nowhere. There are no quality matches on Hinge. Period. Don‚Äôt waste your time, this app is a scam.
title: The worst app I‚Äôve used

developerResponse: {'id': 5566395, 'body': 'So sorry for the delay! It\'s unacceptable that you\'d see even one fake account on Hinge, let alone five. Please email us at hello@hinge.co with the subject line "Review" we\'ll escalate this immediately.', 'modified': '2018-10-18T21:14:55Z'}
review: I will say I talked with several guys in the 2+ weeks I used this app. Unfortunately, I had a creepy vibe with every one of them.  They ALL asked to take the conversation to WhatsApp.  I had never even heard of WhatsApp until I tried Hinge.  I‚Äôve talked to people on Bumble and Match and was never asked to use WhatsApp.  I understand WhatsApp is used in foreign countries to get around the internet blocking. üòíThat was a red flag with the first guy. Well, actually, the red flags with the first guy came when he said he lived in Texas, but was from Italy and his wife and children were killed in a car accident several years ago. üò≥.  The second guy‚Äôs profile showed he lived in Ft. Worth, but after we started talking, supposedly he was in the Army and stationed in Syria. Seriously?!!  I had at least 5 guys ask to go to WhatsApp.  And 2 supposedly stationed in Syria.  Unfortunately, I paid for 3 months, but it was only about $25.  I deleted my profile, canceled my account, and deleted the app entirely. I‚Äôm just hoping that none of my personal information has been compromised.  Of course, I sent several emails to customer support about all of this, but no one answered.  Bumble always replies.  Can‚Äôt believe people are giving this app great reviews.  Have to wonder if they‚Äôre fake too.  Run away!!!
title: All Scammers!  And No Customer Service.  üò°

review:
I‚Äôve been on the app for about three months and only had one match so far, and he never responded to me. When I left another comment to see if he was interested, he unmatched with me. 

It seems to have much more attractive people than Match, but I suspect that‚Äôs because many of the profiles on Hinge are fake, either scammers or profiles that Hinge allows and maybe ‚Äúencourages‚Äù because they are attractive and interesting. They put those people in their ‚ÄúStandouts‚Äù where you have to pay to like them. I‚Äôve seen the same people show up in the Standouts multiple times. I‚Äôve paid for the roses, but it‚Äôs really a waste of money as these guys will never match with me or probably anyone else. I get maybe one ‚Äúlike‚Äù a day, and it‚Äôs never anyone I want to match with. I‚Äôve also seen profiles that use photos from influencers, and I‚Äôve reported them. I even came across two profiles that had the exact same unique response to a prompt, and when I looked up their photos, they were fake.

All the apps seem to have a lot of fake profiles on them, but I have had much better success with Bumble, more matches and actually meeting people in person from there.
title: Full of Fake Profiles

review:
This app is definitely the best experience with dating apps and I don‚Äôt even mind (that much) the paywall experience because if the app is doing its job, it should make money‚Ä¶ however I‚Äôve noticed time and again that my ‚Äúroses‚Äù always seem to decline quicker than I thought. For a long time I just assumed I had less roses than I thought. However today, I woke up with 11, I liked one profile with a rose, and am at 7.

I don‚Äôt mind paying for a good thing, what I hate is stealing. And while I suspected thievery, I can‚Äôt recommend this app as much as previous with such practices.

Not to mention I‚Äôve been discovering what feels like more and more fake profiles. People that connect with you, only to not respond back to a single message sent. If it were just 1-2, I could understand those to be one offs, but it‚Äôs more often than not. So I suspect these to be fake profiles. Feels like this has been happening more and more vs roughly 1-2 years ago. (Haven‚Äôt been on the app continuously, but as relationships end).
title: Was good, but going down hill

review: Your account will be deleted for no reason, and when you contact support and ask why, they‚Äôll tell you that they‚Äôre not allowed to tell you, but for the three days that I WAS on the app, it turns out that they just import all the same fake profiles that they have their dev teams make from all the other matchgroupllc inc apps, such as meetme, tinder, pof, clover, etc. we are demanded of our info, yet they can‚Äôt fight off basic bots, and run 10+ apps? Something‚Äôs wrong when they have a liberal political agenda with all that extra pronoun crap, and also supposedly the best phone number security, yet are filled with bots. Also, so world class yet can‚Äôt have a customer support team tell you why your account was deleted. I bet I have a feeling it‚Äôs because I didn‚Äôt allow them to market my account, which is a hidden button you have to manually click, or else they market your account as if you specifically were saying yes to being advertised as successful to THEIR investors. It‚Äôs all a love interest scam. Made to be deleted, yeah you will be deleted by them. None of the profiles on there are real either, just the same imported bots from all their other apps. Kinda suspicious
title: They import the same bots from their other apps.

review:
This app has has a recent influx of fake profiles managed by individuals who are living abroad in Asia, the Middle East, and Nigeria. It‚Äôs very disappointing. I‚Äôm a frequent user and In one week I've matched with at least 3 fake profiles users. Ways you‚Äôll know if the profile is fake? These users are portraying themselves as military men or men who are working for ‚Äúa top private government agency‚Äù overseas. They‚Äôll ask right away.. ‚Äúhow long have you been on this site‚Äù... ‚Äúwhat are you here for‚Äù... ‚Äúare you single or married‚Äù.. and ‚Äúwhat do you for a job/living..‚Äù this is a dead giveaway! 
Then they‚Äôll tell you they are overseas on deployment/work or are leaving in a few weeks/days. They‚Äôll immediately want to move outside the app to a chat program like ‚ÄúWhatsApp‚Äù..‚Äù kicks‚Äù... or any other site to continue talking to you and getting familiar. 
The end goal is getting you to send them money by gift cards or western union.  I‚Äôve reported these profiles on the site but they still come up in the search engine and at times are used twice with different names. This app is very practical but the security needs to step up to ensure the users aren‚Äôt falling in to these dating scams by allowing these scammers to communicate. I hope it changes for the best.
title: Beware of Catfish & dating Scammers

review: Women on this app are scam who want guys to buy them fancy dinners and vacations.  If the guy pushes back by saying let‚Äôs grab a cup of coffee first before I make a bigger financial and time commitment they can call names. Since it doesn‚Äôt work out for them they will mark the guy a harasser and hinge will gladly delete your account. Appeal process is nothing but a joke. Despite providing all the text messages to prove that no harassment occurred,  they won‚Äôt reinstate the account.  Woman in this case even lied about her age.  I also saw some AI generated profiles.  There are better odds of meeting a real woman at a grocery store or a Starbucks than Hinge.  Not only you will burn a hole in your pocket with a membership fee but also getting scammed by these women.  This woman wanted me to buy her $500 plus dinner on the first date and even take her to Maldives for a vacation while we keep our boundaries **LOL** There was even an ask for gifts but she won‚Äôt meet for a cup of coffee.  Hinge staff actually sympathizes with her because the guy pushed back on her demands.  After all they need honey traps to make money.   Could be one of their agents too.  Guys save your money and time.  Support a local business instead.
title: Scam Alert - I if wish if there were 0 stars

review: I downloaded this app after looking at multiple high-rated reviews online. After putting in my birthday during the sign-up process, the app suddenly locked me out and wouldn‚Äôt allow me to process any further, claiming that I was under the age of 18. I‚Äôm 20, and could have sworn that I put in the correct birth date. Figuring I may have made a mistake, I followed the corrective process suggested by the app‚Äôs official policy page and submitted a picture of my photo ID, blacking out all personal details except the ones requested. This process is the officially recommended one, as there‚Äôs a link at the bottom of the ‚ÄúSorry, you‚Äôre 18‚Äù page that takes you directly to a draft email to customer support with detailed instructions on what to do. After repeating this process twice, I not only received no email back, but remained locked from using the service. I eventually deleted the app but now worry that it may have been a scam, and that my image and information could be used for illegal purposes. It‚Äôs possibly just a case of oversight or negligence, but I would like to finally hear back from their customer support team about what happened and if my ID was deleted from their servers. For other users, be wary that this can happen
title: Image and Info Stolen? Scam?

review: I get at least one return ‚Äúlike‚Äù a week, and sometimes the conversations last a couple of days, but most the time they are brief.  Either way the end result is being ghosted.  I have had conversations that I thought were going well, and all of a sudden they stop responding.  I have even had conversations go well, right up tell I asked to meet.  Some just like you back and never say a word.  I don‚Äôt know if this is the new norm in the dating world or if Hinge has fake accounts that are ran by their employees, and they just string you along to keep you coming back to the app. Either way, I have been on here for two months and not a single date, but I have been ghosted by everyone that liked me back.  The app also needs to get rid of the roses and just have the like option.  They also need to increase how much you can type on the initial interaction.  I like to send witty comments to try and get a laugh, and I typically could use more words to get the punchline out.  The good thing about the app is that you can adjust your preferences to be as picky as you want or do not want.
title: Ghosts!!!

review: This app is a giant scam. There is a discover tab that is your basic show me a profile and like or dislike and then there is a standout tab that shows you standout profiles that you can‚Äôt just like you have to send a rose to them. Roses are $3 unless you buy in bulk. It all sounds fine until you start going through profiles on each tab and realize they learn what type of people you‚Äôre interested in and who you‚Äôre not and then they cycle tons and tons of profiles you‚Äôre not even remotely similar to on the discover tab and then show you 12 people all who you‚Äôd love to get a chance with in the standout section behind an absurd paywall that doesn‚Äôt even guarantee you a conversation with them. Totally kills the app. Makes it a giant waste of time unless you want to fork over your life savings. There is also a premium plan for $30 a month and the great benefits you get are a whopping unlimited amount of likes rather than the 10 you get each day. Still only get 1 free rose every Sunday and it‚Äôs still the same intentional cycle of people they know you‚Äôre not interested in and then tempt you with everyone they know you like behind a paywall. Total scam to the highest degree.
title: Scam Alert!

review:
New limit is ridiculous and forces people to respond with no intention of developing a conversation but just to meet the quota of 8 messages. Tons of
Bots and bait and switch. Trying to upsell you with highly sought after matches then once you subscribe they‚Äôre gone. Even once you pay for a subscription they still bait and switch and use highly sought members to entice you to buy roses or whatever. The same matches will never show up in your normal search even though they fit within your search parameters and meet all your match preferences. These are being used to upsell people to spend more money. Most matches you do get are flaky and don‚Äôt actually want to go out or talk or meet in person. This is a huge money making SCAM preying on peoples deep entrenched desire to connect. Delivering false promises while hidden algorithms are picking and choosing winners and losers. Shady. Immoral. Unethical. Deceptive. Manipulative. False business practice. Litigation in the works. None of this is disclosed in the agreement/contract you sign when you subscribe to the service. This is more than substantial grounds for a lawsuit. Stay tuned
title: Matches

review:
I wanted to like this app as it does produce something different from the others. The profiling helps to build a personality when they allow you to use videos and voice recordings which was cool. 

However, I have joined hinge two separate times and was overwhelmed by how many scammers there were on this app compared to bumble. Then I learned that not all profiles are verified users yet they are continuing active on the app. I tried to filter by verified users only and Hinge give no such option. I think this is a big downfall since online dating has become a huge market for scammers to scam or con artists trying to get information as basic as their phone numbers, and then asking for investment opportunities or bitcoins. I have chatted with few people on hinge into thinking they were real people until they asked for phone number and then eventually asking for money. I wasted all these effort getting to know someone naively. I never have this on bumble since they verified their users before being activated. You guys should do the same! Protect your users!!!
title: Spam scam phishing!!

review:
I have had my account for a while with like four photos, all of which were head shots. Very simple bio with just a few details about myself. So basically just a normal every day profile. Never had an issue with my profile since I had it for several months and I log back in after about a few days of not being on and I‚Äôm told my account was banned for violating policy. I find that very odd because if you saw my profile you would scratch your head as well and say this is a very plain every day profile. I reach out to them asking why and to file an appeal, they respond with your account will remain banned. They allow you to appeal, but what‚Äôs the point if you don‚Äôt even know what you‚Äôre appealing because they won‚Äôt tell you which I find kind of odd. There‚Äôs so many fakes on that app and scams, but they don‚Äôt get banned. Figure that one out. Could be them trying to get you to buy stuff to send to people. Wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if half those fake profiles are created by Hinge. 

The app isn‚Äôt bad, but how‚Äôs it run and it‚Äôs customer service is absolutely horrendous. So many better apps out there.
title: Banned for no reason. What a joke
